name: AnthropicModel

input.content:
I have a webpage that's open in a chrome browser but the page no longer exists. 
What javascript should I type in the console to get a copy of the entire page html?

output:
To get a copy of the entire page HTML, even if the page no longer exists, you can use the following JavaScript code in the Chrome Developer Console:

```javascript
console.log(document.documentElement.outerHTML);
```

This code will log the entire HTML content of the page to the console. You can then right-click on the logged HTML in the console and select "Copy object" to copy the HTML to your clipboard.

Alternatively, you can use this code to directly copy the HTML to your clipboard:

```javascript
copy(document.documentElement.outerHTML);
```

After running this code, the entire HTML will be copied to your clipboard, and you can paste it into a text editor or save it as an HTML file.

Note: The `copy()` function is a convenience function provided by the Chrome Developer Console. It may not work in other browsers' consoles.
